what: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
title: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
text: announce_post function automates task announcing blog post. extracts metadata post's YAML front matter, generates relevant messages, posts announcements various platforms: Bluesky, LinkedIn, Mastodon, via newsletter.

title: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
text: post character vector length one, representing file path blog post. function supports single file path uses first value provided one.

title: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
text: function explicitly return value (NULL). performs side effects creating posts external platforms sending newsletter.

title: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post
text: Checks post argument provided raises errors warnings needed. Reads YAML front matter blog post extract metadata tags, slug, image, additional fields used announcements. Converts tags hashtag-based format. Constructs shortened URL blog post based slug. Posts announcement : Bluesky: Posts truncated message along image. LinkedIn: Posts full summary along image. Mastodon: Posts SEO description, image, alternative text. Sends metadata generate newsletter notification.

title: Announce a Blog Post Across Multiple Platforms â€” cast_announce_post

what: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
title: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
text: send_newsletter function sends newsletter created using metadata extracted blog post's front matter. communicates ConvertKit API create schedule email broadcast.

title: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
text: frontmatter named list containing metadata extracted blog post YAML. list include following fields: seo string containing SEO description blog post. image string relative path blog post's thumbnail image. title string containing blog post's title. url Character, url post.

title: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
text: function explicitly return value (NULL). performs side effect sending newsletter ConvertKit API.

title: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
text: function generates HTML content newsletter using glue package (placeholders custom templates need defined). constructs HTTP POST request ConvertKit API, passing various fields email subject, thumbnail_url, content. API key authentication fetched environment variable KIT_SECRET.

title: Send a Newsletter Using ConvertKit API â€” cast_send_newsletter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example frontmatter frontmatter <- list(   seo = "This is an amazing blog post about R programming!",   image = "images/blog-thumbnail.jpg",   title = "Learning R Programming" )  # Sending a newsletter send_newsletter(frontmatter) } # }

what: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
title: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
text: create_message function generates formatted message string using information blog post's metadata, including title, custom text, randomly selected emoji, URL, associated tags.

title: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
text: frontmatter list yaml section uri url post

title: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
text: character string containing formatted message, includes: Title title blog post. Emoji randomly generated emoji add personality message. Text input text, passed entirety. URL link blog post. Tags Hashtags derived blog's metadata.

title: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
text: function uses glue package assemble string placeholders pre-defined variables, including blog post title, emoji, URI, tags. variables exist global environment accessible scope function called.

title: Create a Formatted Announcement Message â€” create_message
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assuming variables are defined in # the global environment: frontmatter <- list(   title = "Learning R Programming" ) emoji <- "\U0001F525" uri <- "https://example.com/a-blog-post" tags <- "#RStats #DataScience"  # Create a message create_message("Check out this insightful blog post!") } # }

what: Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
title: Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
text: li_client function initializes OAuth client authenticate interact LinkedIn API. uses environment variables retrieve LinkedIn application credentials (client ID client secret).

title: Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
text: OAuth client object class httr2_request can used authenticate make requests LinkedIn API.

title: Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
text: function uses httr2::oauth_client function create OAuth client LinkedIn. following environment variables must set: LI_CLIENT_ID LinkedIn application client ID. LI_CLIENT_SECRET LinkedIn application client secret.

title: Create an OAuth Client for LinkedIn API â€” li_client
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create an OAuth client for LinkedIn client <- li_client()  client } # }

what: Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
title: Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
text: li_get_version function calculates recent past month's LinkedIn version date formats string YYYYMM format. date used reference LinkedIn-specific API versions functionalities tied monthly updates.

title: Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
text: character string representing version date YYYYMM format, YYYY 4-digit year, MM 2-digit month.

title: Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
text: function calculates version date taking current date rolling back previous month. result formatted string YYYYMM format using lubridate stringr packages.

title: Get the LinkedIn Version Date in YYYYMM Format â€” li_get_version
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ li_get_version()  # Store the version date in a variable li_get_version() } # }

what: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
title: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
text: li_media_upload function uploads media file (e.g., image) LinkedIn use posts content. first initializes upload process LinkedInâ€™s API, uploads media file provided upload URL.

title: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
text: author character string representing LinkedIn profile organization ID format urn:li:person:XXXX urn:li:organization:XXXX. identifies owner media uploaded. media character string representing file path media (e.g., image file) uploaded.

title: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
text: character string representing LinkedIn image URL can used reference uploaded media subsequent API calls.

title: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
text: function performs following steps: Initializes media upload sending request LinkedIn API. Extracts uploadUrl response, specifies upload media file. Uploads media file uploadUrl. Returns image URL generated LinkedIn referencing uploaded file. li_req() function, assumed create authenticated LinkedIn API request, must available calling environment.

title: Upload Media to LinkedIn â€” li_media_upload
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assign LinkedIn author and media to upload author <- "urn:li:person:123456789" media <- "path/to/image.png"  # Upload the media file image_url <- li_media_upload(author, media)  # Use the returned image URL in a post image_url } # }

what: Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
title: Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
text: li_oauth function facilitates OAuth 2.0 authentication interacting LinkedIn API. uses authorization code flow generate OAuth token.

title: Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
text: OAuth token object (class httr2_token) can used authenticate subsequent API requests LinkedIn.

title: Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
text: function performs following steps: Calls li_client() initialize OAuth client using LinkedIn client ID secret (stored environment variables: LI_CLIENT_ID LI_CLIENT_SECRET). Constructs authorization URL required state, scope, client details. Executes authorization code flow using httr2::oauth_flow_auth_code, : Prompts user allow access. Supports redirection http://localhost:1444/ complete authorization process. Specifies required LinkedIn permissions (scope): email, openid, profile, w_member_social.

title: Perform LinkedIn OAuth Authentication â€” li_oauth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Perform LinkedIn OAuth authentication and save the token token <- li_oauth()  # Use the token for authenticated API requests token } # }

what: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
title: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
text: function publishes new post LinkedIn using specified author, text content, optional image, associated image alt text. supports adding media attachments retries requests transient errors.

title: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
text: author string representing unique LinkedIn author URN (Uniform Resource Name). text string representing textual content LinkedIn post. text escaped ensure LinkedIn compatibility. image (Optional) string representing file path image attached post. Defaults NULL image included. image_alt (Optional) string representing alternate text image (e.g., accessibility). Defaults empty string "".

title: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
text: Invisibly returns LinkedIn post ID string. Displays message LinkedIn URL published post.

title: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
text: image provided, function automatically uploads image LinkedIn using li_media_upload() helper function (defined ). post configured public visibility main feed distribution. Error retries applied certain HTTP status codes.

title: Create and Publish a LinkedIn Post â€” li_post_write
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Publish a simple text post: li_post_write(   author = "urn:li:person:exampleAuthor",   text = "This is a simple LinkedIn post!" )  # Publish a post with an image: li_post_write(   author = "urn:li:person:exampleAuthor",   text = "Check out this image!",   image = "path/to/image.jpg",   image_alt = "A description of the image for accessibility" ) } # }

what: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
title: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
text: function creates pre-configured HTTP request object interacting LinkedIn API. sets API endpoint version, essential headers, includes authentication.

title: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
text: endpoint_version string specifying LinkedIn API endpoint version. Defaults "rest". possible values include "v2" specific API versions. ... Additional arguments passed li_req_auth() function authentication configuration.

title: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
text: HTTP request object default headers authentication configured, can used httr2 methods perform API queries.

title: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
text: function initializes request targeting LinkedIn API's base URL (https://api.linkedin.com) appends specified endpoint version URL path. sets headers API versioning, protocol compatibility, Content-Type. Authentication handled li_req_auth().

title: Create a Base LinkedIn API Request â€” li_req
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a request with default settings req <- li_req()  # Create a request object req <- li_req(     endpoint_version = "v2",     token = Sys.getenv("LI_TOKEN") ) } # }

what: Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me
title: Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me
text: function fetches LinkedIn Uniform Resource Name (URN) currently authenticated user using LinkedIn API. Authentication performed using bearer token stored LI_TOKEN environment variable.

title: Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me
Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me
text: string representing user's LinkedIn URN format "urn:li:person:{id}".

title: Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me
text: function sends API request LinkedIn userinfo endpoint appropriate authorization token extracts user's unique identifier (sub). identifier formatted LinkedIn URN.

title: Retrieve the LinkedIn URN of the User â€” li_urn_me

what: Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji
title: Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji
text: random_emoji function selects returns random emoji predefined list emojis. function often used add personality fun messages announcements.

title: Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji
Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji
text: single character string containing randomly selected emoji.

title: Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji
text: function draws fixed list commonly used emojis. time function called, selects one emoji random returns . input parameters required.

title: Generate a Random Emoji â€” random_emoji

what: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
title: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
text: short_url sends POST request Short.io API create new shortened URL provided uri. function uses environment variable SHORTIO API key sets specific options API call, allowing duplicate links setting fixed domain shortened URL.

title: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
text: uri character string. original URL shortened.

title: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
text: character string. shortened URL returned Short.io API.

title: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
text: function takes given URL leverages Short.io API generate shortened version URL using specified custom domain.

title: Shorten a URL using the Short.io API â€” short_url
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Example usage to shorten a URL   Sys.setenv(SHORTIO = "your_api_key_here") # Set API key in environment   short_url("https://www.example.com/very-long-url") } # }

what: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
title: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
text: strlength splits input string individual characters counts using strsplit length. equivalent determining string length.

title: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
text: x character string. input string whose length calculated.

title: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
text: integer. total number characters input string.

title: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
text: function calculates total number characters given string.

title: Compute the Number of Characters in a String â€” strlength
code: # Example usage: strlength("hello")        # Returns: 5 #> [1] 5 strlength("R is great!")  # Returns: 11 #> [1] 11

what: Converts tags into a hash-tagged string â€” tags2hash
title: Converts tags into a hash-tagged string â€” tags2hash
text: Converts tags hash-tagged string

title: Converts tags into a hash-tagged string â€” tags2hash
Converts tags into a hash-tagged string â€” tags2hash
text: tags character vector tags (e.g., c("R", "Health data")).

title: Converts tags into a hash-tagged string â€” tags2hash
text: single string tags converted hash-tagged format (e.g., "#Rstats #HealthData"). Specific transformation applied: - Converts "r" (case insensitive) "rstats". - Removes spaces within tags. - Collapses elements one space-separated string.
